prompt: What are MT teacher’s fields of study?
name: SPQ_5
updated: Thu Jan 19 2017 08:28:14 GMT+0300 (E. Africa Standard Time)

enumeratorHelp:
Good morning. My name is ___________________________ and I work with the ____________. We are here to monitor and evaluate Mother Tongue (MT) Curriculum implementation in order to identify areas of support that might be needed to improve the implementation of the MT Curriculum.  We will not be using person’s names in our reporting and findings will be kept confidential.

In today’s visit, we are particularly interested in seeking your consent for overall activities that we do in the school in this regard: principal interview, teachers interview (examining language and literacy practice in classrooms, see teacher’s lesson plan and assess use of teachers guide), students interview and exercise book inspection, and classroom observation with sampled students.

Do you have any questions you would like to ask? Do you agree to participate in this survey and allow your teachers and students to participate?
prompt: We are here to monitor and evaluate Mother Tongue (MT) Curriculum implementation in order to identify areas of support that might be needed to improve the implementation of the MT Curriculum. Do you have any questions you would like to ask? Do you agree to participate in this survey and allow your teachers and students to participate?
name: Consent

studentDialog:
The following questions are related to the implementation and use of the Mother Tongue Resource Package at Colleges of Teacher Education in Ethiopia.

The Mother Tongue Resource Package was designed and deployed by READ TA in support of pre-service Mother Tongue instruction at the CTEs.

The MT Resource Packages consists of:

1. One server and related networking devices, as well as UPS per CTE to systematically manage the content on the distributed tablet devices.
2. One document camera, one projector, and one set of speakers per CTE which will allow lecturers not only to use tablet-based content for their own consumption in professional development and lecture preparation, but also to share and project resources from the tablet during lecture delivery with their students in large classrooms.
3. One tablet device for each mother tongue lecturer to be used in personal professional development, lecture preparation, and lecture delivery. The tablets contains the following MT resources:
4. Model videos in MT (accessible through the MX Player app)
5. Audio files in MT for grades 1 and 2 phonemic awareness activities and teacher read-alouds (accessible through the Music folder player app)
6. Papaya, phonological awareness app
7. The new Student Books and Teacher Guide in MT
8. Module content for 7 of the pre-service teacher training courses

We are investigating the use of the MT Resource Package at the CTEs and the local support provided for it.

While you are at the CTE, please do your best to do all of the below:

1. Check in with the Dean or Vice Dean, just asking them a few question about how things are going.
2. Check in with the ICT Officers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the technology parts of the package is going, what the main issues (if any) seem to be, how the MT lecturers are using it and how the CTE leadership is supporting this initiative.
3. Check in with 2-3 of the MT Lecturers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the MT Resource package is going and how well they are being supported by their CTE.

Collecting this data helps READ TA be able to monitor progress and provide support if needed.
Thanks for your efforts in filling in this checklist!!

studentDialog:
The following questions are related to the implementation and use of the Mother Tongue Resource Package at Colleges of Teacher Education in Ethiopia.

The Mother Tongue Resource Package was designed and deployed by READ TA in support of pre-service Mother Tongue instruction at the CTEs.

The MT Resource Packages consists of:

1. One server and related networking devices, as well as UPS per CTE to systematically manage the content on the distributed tablet devices.
2. One document camera, one projector, and one set of speakers per CTE which will allow lecturers not only to use tablet-based content for their own consumption in professional development and lecture preparation, but also to share and project resources from the tablet during lecture delivery with their students in large classrooms.
3. One tablet device for each mother tongue lecturer to be used in personal professional development, lecture preparation, and lecture delivery. The tablets contains the following MT resources:
4. Model videos in MT (accessible through the MX Player app)
5. Audio files in MT for grades 1 and 2 phonemic awareness activities and teacher read-alouds (accessible through the Music folder player app)
6. Papaya, phonological awareness app
7. The new Student Books and Teacher Guide in MT
8. Module content for:

  • TMT 201: Cognitive Development and Literacy Skills
  • TMT 222: Teaching Reading and Writing in the Primary School
  • TMT 224: Teaching Listening and Speaking in the Primary School
  • TMT 322: Assessing Language Skills and Differentiated Instruction

We are investigating the use of the MT Resource Package at the CTEs and the local support provided for it.

While you are at the CTE, please do your best to do all of the below:
 

1. Check in with the Dean or Vice Dean, just asking them a few question about how things are going.
2. Check in with the ICT Officers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the technology parts of the package is going, what the main issues (if any) seem to be, how the MT lecturers are using it and how the CTE leadership is supporting this initiative.
3. Check in with 2-3 of the MT Lecturers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the MT Resource package is going and how well they are being supported by their CTE.
4. Try to visit one lecture and observe if and how the lecturer is using the MT resource package and/or the revised modules for pre-service teacher education on reading and writing in Mother Tongue.

Collecting this data helps READ TA be able to monitor progress and provide support if needed.
Thanks for your efforts in filling in this checklist!!

studentDialog:
The following questions are related to the implementation and use of the Mother Tongue Resource Package at Colleges of Teacher Education in Ethiopia.

The Mother Tongue Resource Package was designed and deployed by READ TA in support of pre-service Mother Tongue instruction at the CTEs.

The MT Resource Packages consists of:

1. One server and related networking devices, as well as UPS per CTE to systematically manage the content on the distributed tablet devices.
2. One document camera, one projector, and one set of speakers per CTE which will allow lecturers not only to use tablet-based content for their own consumption in professional development and lecture preparation, but also to share and project resources from the tablet during lecture delivery with their students in large classrooms.
3. One tablet device for each mother tongue lecturer to be used in personal professional development, lecture preparation, and lecture delivery. The tablets contains the following MT resources:
4. Model videos in MT (accessible through the MX Player app)
5. Audio files in MT for grades 1 and 2 phonemic awareness activities and teacher read-alouds (accessible through the Music folder player app)
6. Papaya, phonological awareness app
7. The new Student Books and Teacher Guide in MT
8. Module content for:

  • TMT 201: Cognitive Development and Literacy Skills
  • TMT 222: Teaching Reading and Writing in the Primary School
  • TMT 224: Teaching Listening and Speaking in the Primary School
  • TMT 322: Assessing Language Skills and Differentiated Instruction

We are investigating the use of the MT Resource Package at the CTEs and the local support provided for it.

While you are at the CTE, please do your best to do all of the below:
 

1. Check in with the Dean or Vice Dean, just asking them a few question about how things are going.
2. Check in with the ICT Officers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the technology parts of the package is going, what the main issues (if any) seem to be, how the MT lecturers are using it and how the CTE leadership is supporting this initiative.
3. Check in with 2-3 of the MT Lecturers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the MT Resource package is going and how well they are being supported by their CTE.
4. Try to visit one lecture and observe if and how the lecturer is using the MT resource package and/or the revised modules for pre-service teacher education on reading and writing in Mother Tongue.

Collecting this data helps READ TA be able to monitor progress and provide support if needed.
Thanks for your efforts in filling in this checklist!!

studentDialog:
The following questions are related to the implementation and use of the Mother Tongue Resource Package at Colleges of Teacher Education in Ethiopia.

The Mother Tongue Resource Package was designed and deployed by READ TA in support of pre-service Mother Tongue instruction at the CTEs.

The MT Resource Packages consists of:

1. One server and related networking devices, as well as UPS per CTE to systematically manage the content on the distributed tablet devices.
2. One document camera, one projector, and one set of speakers per CTE which will allow lecturers not only to use tablet-based content for their own consumption in professional development and lecture preparation, but also to share and project resources from the tablet during lecture delivery with their students in large classrooms.
3. One tablet device for each mother tongue lecturer to be used in personal professional development, lecture preparation, and lecture delivery. The tablets contains the following MT resources:
4. Model videos in MT (accessible through the MX Player app)
5. Audio files in MT for grades 1 and 2 phonemic awareness activities and teacher read-alouds (accessible through the Music folder player app)
6. Papaya, phonological awareness app
7. The new Student Books and Teacher Guide in MT
8. Module content for 7 of the pre-service teacher training courses

We are investigating the use of the MT Resource Package at the CTEs and the local support provided for it.

While you are at the CTE, please do your best to do all of the below:

1. Check in with the Dean or Vice Dean, just asking them a few question about how things are going.
2. Check in with the ICT Officers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the technology parts of the package is going, what the main issues (if any) seem to be, how the MT lecturers are using it and how the CTE leadership is supporting this initiative.
3. Check in with 2-3 of the MT Lecturers at the CTE, asking them a few question about how the use of the MT Resource package is going and how well they are being supported by their CTE.

Collecting this data helps READ TA be able to monitor progress and provide support if needed.
Thanks for your efforts in filling in this checklist!!
